The irony is that the biggest complaint about privacy coins is the inability to check your balance on a public block explorer.

Which is a completely bonkers habit we only developed because of Bitcoin and Ethereum

1015047628269203460.text:
Bitcoin and Ethereum wallets: private keys instead of passwords, no recovery, all transactions public

Privacy coins: hard to check your balance or to confirm if you’ve received a payment

Payment channels: need to be online periodically and whenever you want to receive payment

1015046123948531718.text:
Payment channels and privacy-coins have unfamiliar UX and require weird new user behaviors. 

But so did Bitcoin and Ethereum wallets!

Users (or at least early adopters) got accustomed to them, and developers built tools to improve them.

925467470525329411.text: Whereas an increase in user demand (an upward shift in the blue curve) has a much higher impact on price. (fin)

925466711272427520.text: So an increase in miner support (remember, a rightward shift in red curve) only has a very modest impact on price at the margin.

925466385639268353.text: My hypothesis is that the red curve is very steep and blue curve is very flat (curious to hear disagreement and happy to discuss further).

925461970257670144.text: Exogenous increase in miner interest (desire to mine a certain currency, w/ price held constant) is a rightward shift in the red curve

925461700836560897.text: Exogenous increase in user demand (desire to buy more of the currency, w/ hashrate held constant) is an upward shift in the blue curve

925456867559649280.text: Red curve slopes up b/c price makes mining more profitable, bringing more miners online and thus increasing hashpower.

925451933426618368.text: Blue curve slopes upward because higher hashrate means more secure chain. But pretty flat (at margin) b/c chain is already secure enough

925446345581846530.text: Bitcoin price is driven by users, rather than miners. Here's a very stylized model showing why I think this is true at the margin. (1/)pic.twitter.com/xDU5GQ82zs
